skill.name: subagent-orchestration
skill.description:
This skill should be used when coordinating multiple subagents, implementing orchestrator
patterns, or managing parallel agent workflows.
Trigger phrases: "orchestrate agents", "coordinate subagents", "parallel agents",
"multi-agent workflow", "delegate to agents", "run agents in parallel", "launch multiple agents".
skill.summary:
This skill should be used when coordinating multiple subagents, implementing orchestrator
patterns, ...
skill.author: DieGopherLT

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only markdown documentation with workflow guidelines. No code execution, network access, file system operations, or external command capabilities. The skill provides best practices for coordinating subagent workflows.

content.user_title: Coordinate Multiple AI Subagents in Parallel
content.value_statement: Managing multiple AI subagents can lead to conflicting changes and scope creep. This skill provides structured guidelines for orchestrating parallel agent workflows with clear boundaries, file scopes, and task isolation.
actual_capabilities: Define clear scopes for subagent tasks with explicit file lists
Specify files that subagents must NOT modify
Coordinate parallel execution of independent subagent tasks
Create task templates with constraints and business rules
Reference documentation using @file syntax for subagent context
limitations: Does not execute code - only provides coordination guidelines
Does not directly invoke subagents - recommendations for users
Requires users to define task scopes manually
Does not enforce task boundaries automatically

use_cases.title: Parallel Code Reviews
use_cases.description: Run multiple subagents to review different modules of a codebase simultaneously

use_cases.title: Independent Feature Work
use_cases.description: Coordinate subagents to work on separate features without conflicts

use_cases.title: Distributed Analysis
use_cases.description: Analyze different system components in parallel for architectural decisions

prompt_templates.title: Basic Subagent Request
prompt_templates.prompt: orchestrate agents: Task: [description]. Files to modify: [list]. Files NOT to touch: [list]. Constraints: [rules].

prompt_templates.title: Parallel Tasks
prompt_templates.prompt: launch multiple agents in parallel: Agent 1: Task [A], modify [files], don't touch [files]. Agent 2: Task [B], modify [files], don't touch [files].

prompt_templates.title: With Documentation
prompt_templates.prompt: coordinate subagents: Task [X]. Reference docs: [@file1, @file2]. Files: [modify], [exclude]. Constraints: [requirements].

prompt_templates.title: Full Scope Definition
prompt_templates.prompt: orchestrate agents with scope: Task [name]. Files to modify: [exact paths]. Files NOT to touch: [specific exclusions]. Business rules: [list]. Technical requirements: [list]. Reference: [@docs].

output_examples.input: orchestrate agents: Review authentication flow and review recent changes
output: Agent 1 scope: Explore authentication flow in auth/ directory
Agent 2 scope: Review recent auth changes in src/auth/, tests/auth/
Files NOT to touch: src/payment/, src/user/

best_practices: Always define explicit file boundaries for each subagent
Specify files NOT to touch to prevent unintended modifications
Use @file references to provide subagents with relevant context
anti_patterns: Vague file specifications like 'update related files'
Missing exclusions that allow subagents to modify unrelated code
Sequential dependencies disguised as parallel tasks

faq.question: What triggers this skill?
faq.answer: Use trigger phrases like orchestrate agents, coordinate subagents, parallel agents, launch multiple agents, or delegate to agents.

faq.question: Can this skill run subagents automatically?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides guidelines for users to define and coordinate subagent tasks with proper scope boundaries.

faq.question: How does parallel execution differ from sequential?
faq.answer: Parallel tasks are completely independent with no shared dependencies. Sequential tasks require results from previous tasks before starting.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only provides guidance. No data is sent externally. Subagents run within your controlled environment.

faq.question: What if subagent scopes overlap?
faq.answer: Avoid overlapping scopes. Define exclusive file lists for each subagent. Use Files NOT to touch to enforce boundaries.

faq.question: How does this compare to single-agent workflows?
faq.answer: This skill enables faster completion of independent tasks by running subagents in parallel. Single-agent workflows handle sequential or dependent tasks.
